intro: Triplophyllum chocoense, commonly known as the Chocoan triplophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
